Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
low-lying \low-lying\ adj. 1. having a small elevation above the ground or horizon or sea level; as, low-lying clouds. [WordNet 1.5]
2. at a low elevation above sea level.
Syn: sea-level. [WordNet 1.5]
low-lying adj 1: having a small elevation above the ground or horizon or sea level; "low-lying clouds" 2: lying below the normal level; "a low-lying desert" [syn: {sea-level}]
